title: What is this multiqc_yaml file?
body:
https://github.com/shenlab-sinai/NGS-Data-Charmer/blob/e91e49e87aac92e216ed2a94569931de9113f9a3/config.yaml#L8

It's better to provide an example of this yaml file. Or, where to obtain it?

title: Need better explanation of aligner and its index
body:
https://github.com/shenlab-sinai/NGS-Data-Charmer/blob/e91e49e87aac92e216ed2a94569931de9113f9a3/config.yaml#L10

Since different aligners have different input arguments, it's better to provide some explanation of this index key. For example, shall I provide a path to the basename of the genome index, or a path to the folder where the index files are located?

title: Hard-coded CPU cores
body:
https://github.com/shenlab-sinai/NGS-Data-Charmer/blob/e91e49e87aac92e216ed2a94569931de9113f9a3/run_snakemake.sh#L2

It's better to add an input argument for the number of CPU cores to the shell script.

title: Blank alignment key
body:
https://github.com/shenlab-sinai/NGS-Data-Charmer/blob/e91e49e87aac92e216ed2a94569931de9113f9a3/config.yaml#L5

Does the pipeline support only one aligner at the moment? What is this `alignment` key suppose to do? Better be explicit than implicit.

title: OpenBLAS blas_thread_init: pthread_create: Resource temporarily unavailable
body:
When I try to run the `run_snakemake_cluster.sh`, I am given this error noted in the traceback. It happens sometimes when using multithreading in Python + OpenBLAS, and occurs specifically upon a NumPy import called by BioPython when importing `Bio.SeqIO` in line 6 of the `Snakefile`.

```py
(ngs_data_charmer) -bash-4.2$ sh run_snakemake_cluster.sh
```
